title: Application Version
description: The version of the application following Semantic Versioning (SemVer) 2.0.0 specification
x-business-rules: BR-VER-001: Pattern constraint enforces data format consistency and error prevention, rejecting invalid formats before they cause system errors
BR-VER-002: Minimum 5 characters ensures application version is sufficiently descriptive for user identification and debugging
x-user-stories: US-VER-001: GIVEN an app with name and simple SemVer version '1.0.0' WHEN user navigates to the homepage THEN version badge should be visible with correct version text
US-VER-002: GIVEN an app with only name (no version property) WHEN user navigates to the homepage THEN version badge should NOT be rendered
US-VER-003: GIVEN an app with pre-release version '2.0.0-beta.1' WHEN user navigates to the homepage THEN badge should display pre-release version exactly as specified
US-VER-004: GIVEN an app with build metadata in version '1.0.0+build.123' WHEN user navigates to the homepage THEN badge should display version with build metadata intact
US-VER-005: GIVEN an app with both pre-release and build metadata '1.0.0-alpha+001' WHEN user navigates to the homepage THEN badge should display complete version string
US-VER-006: GIVEN an app with name and version WHEN user navigates to the homepage THEN badge should appear before (above) the app name heading
US-VER-007: GIVEN an app with version WHEN user navigates to the homepage THEN badge should have proper accessibility attributes (data-testid, data-slot)
x-linked-tests: specs/app/version.spec.ts::should display version badge with correct version text
specs/app/version.spec.ts::should not render version badge when version is undefined
specs/app/version.spec.ts::should display version with build metadata
specs/app/version.spec.ts::should display complete version with pre-release and build metadata
specs/app/version.spec.ts::should appear before app name heading
